field.name: summary
field.value: ${?var} syntax causes Boo compile error: BCE0043: Unexpected token: output.

field.name: description
field.value:
Since updating to revision 5346, I've been unable to use the ${?var} or !{?var} syntax anywhere in my Brail views. Using the ${?var} syntax gives me a compile error from Boo: "BCE0043: Unexpected token: output." !{?var} gives a similar error, except with "OutputEscaped" as the unexpected token. Removing the question mark causes the error to go away, so it seems that the problem is with it.
From what I can see in the debugger, it's failing to replace "?var" with "TryGetParameter('var')" in the code when specified as ${?var}.
Putting "<% output ?var %>" or "<% OutputEscaped ?var %>" into the same view works fine. I looked at the NullPropagationTest view and it's only using that syntax, so perhaps there should be an additional test for the other syntax.

comment.author: mdavis
comment.text: I've attached a patch that fixed the issue for me. It includes a new test case to check for this in the future.
